intro: Dimeria santapaui, commonly known as the Santa Paula dimeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually small and pinnately lobed, and it produces capsules as its fruit. Dimeria santapaui is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
